trans-unit.source: Description: Whether your app is free or not, you can sell content, other apps, or new app functionality (such as unlocking the next level of a game) from right within the app.
trans-unit.target: Description: Whether your app is free or not, you can sell content, other apps, or new app functionality (such as unlocking the next level of a game) from right within the app.

trans-unit.source: Here we show you how to enable these products in your app.
trans-unit.target: Here we show you how to enable these products in your app.

trans-unit.source: title: Enable in-app product purchases ms.assetid: D158E9EB-1907-4173-9889-66507957BD6B keywords: in-app offer keywords: in-app purchase keywords: in-app product keywords: how to support in-app keywords: in-app purchase code sample keywords: in-app offer code sample
trans-unit.target: title: Enable in-app product purchases ms.assetid: D158E9EB-1907-4173-9889-66507957BD6B keywords: in-app offer keywords: in-app purchase keywords: in-app product keywords: how to support in-app keywords: in-app purchase code sample keywords: in-app offer code sample

trans-unit.source: Enable in-app product purchases
trans-unit.target: Enable in-app product purchases

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Whether your app is free or not, you can sell content, other apps, or new app functionality (such as unlocking the next level of a game) from right within the app.
trans-unit.target: Whether your app is free or not, you can sell content, other apps, or new app functionality (such as unlocking the next level of a game) from right within the app.

trans-unit.source: Here we show you how to enable these products in your app.
trans-unit.target: Here we show you how to enable these products in your app.

trans-unit.source: **Note** In-app products cannot be offered from a trial version of an app.
trans-unit.target: **Note** In-app products cannot be offered from a trial version of an app.

trans-unit.source: Customers using a trial version of your app can only buy an in-app product if they purchase a full version of your app.
trans-unit.target: Customers using a trial version of your app can only buy an in-app product if they purchase a full version of your app.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: A Windows app in which to add features for customers to buy.
trans-unit.target: A Windows app in which to add features for customers to buy.

trans-unit.source: When you code and test new in-app products for the first time, you must use the [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) object instead of the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) object.
trans-unit.target: When you code and test new in-app products for the first time, you must use the [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) object instead of the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) object.

trans-unit.source: This way you can verify your license logic using simulated calls to the license server instead of calling the live server.
trans-unit.target: This way you can verify your license logic using simulated calls to the license server instead of calling the live server.

trans-unit.source: To do this, you need to customize the file named "WindowsStoreProxy.xml" in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\<package name>\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.
trans-unit.target: To do this, you need to customize the file named "WindowsStoreProxy.xml" in %userprofile%\\AppData\\local\\packages\\<package name>\\LocalState\\Microsoft\\Windows Store\\ApiData.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Visual Studio simulator creates this file when you run your app for the first time—or you can also load a custom one at runtime.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Visual Studio simulator creates this file when you run your app for the first time—or you can also load a custom one at runtime.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766).

trans-unit.source: This topic also references code examples provided in the [Store sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=627610).
trans-unit.target: This topic also references code examples provided in the [Store sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=627610).

trans-unit.source: This sample is a great way to get hands-on experience with the different monetization options provided for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
trans-unit.target: This sample is a great way to get hands-on experience with the different monetization options provided for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Initialize the license info for your app
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Initialize the license info for your app

trans-unit.source: When your app is initializing, get the [**LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225157) object for your app by initializing the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) or [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) to enable purchases of an in-app product.
trans-unit.target: When your app is initializing, get the [**LicenseInformation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225157) object for your app by initializing the [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) or [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) to enable purchases of an in-app product.

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Add the in-app offers to your app
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Add the in-app offers to your app

trans-unit.source: For each feature that you want to make available through an in-app product, create an offer and add it to your app.
trans-unit.target: For each feature that you want to make available through an in-app product, create an offer and add it to your app.

trans-unit.source: **Important** You must add all the in-app products that you want to present to your customers to your app before you submit it to the Store.
trans-unit.target: **Important** You must add all the in-app products that you want to present to your customers to your app before you submit it to the Store.

trans-unit.source: If you want to add new in-app products later, you must update your app and re-submit a new version.
trans-unit.target: If you want to add new in-app products later, you must update your app and re-submit a new version.

trans-unit.source: Create an in-app offer token
trans-unit.target: Create an in-app offer token

trans-unit.source: You identify each in-app product in your app by a token.
trans-unit.target: You identify each in-app product in your app by a token.

trans-unit.source: This token is a string that you define and use in your app and in the Store to identify a specific in-app product.
trans-unit.target: This token is a string that you define and use in your app and in the Store to identify a specific in-app product.

trans-unit.source: Give it a unique (to your app) and meaningful name so that you can quickly identify the correct feature it represents while you are coding.
trans-unit.target: Give it a unique (to your app) and meaningful name so that you can quickly identify the correct feature it represents while you are coding.

trans-unit.source: Here are some examples of names:
trans-unit.target: Here are some examples of names:

trans-unit.source: "SpaceMissionLevel4"
trans-unit.target: "SpaceMissionLevel4"

trans-unit.source: "ContosoCloudSave"
trans-unit.target: "ContosoCloudSave"

trans-unit.source: "RainbowThemePack".
trans-unit.target: "RainbowThemePack".

trans-unit.source: Code the feature in a conditional block
trans-unit.target: Code the feature in a conditional block

trans-unit.source: You must put the code for each feature that is associated with an in-app product in a conditional block that tests to see if the customer has a license to use that feature.
trans-unit.target: You must put the code for each feature that is associated with an in-app product in a conditional block that tests to see if the customer has a license to use that feature.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example that shows how you can code a product feature named **featureName** in a license-specific conditional block.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example that shows how you can code a product feature named **featureName** in a license-specific conditional block.

trans-unit.source: The string, **featureName**, is the token that uniquely identifies this product within the app and is also used to identify it in the Store.
trans-unit.target: The string, **featureName**, is the token that uniquely identifies this product within the app and is also used to identify it in the Store.

trans-unit.source: Add the purchase UI for this feature
trans-unit.target: Add the purchase UI for this feature

trans-unit.source: Your app must also provide a way for your customers to purchase the product or feature offered by the in-app product.
trans-unit.target: Your app must also provide a way for your customers to purchase the product or feature offered by the in-app product.

trans-unit.source: They can't purchase them through the Store in the same way they purchased the full app.
trans-unit.target: They can't purchase them through the Store in the same way they purchased the full app.

trans-unit.source: Here's how to test to see if your customer already owns an in-app product and, if they don't, displays the purchase dialog so they can buy it.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to test to see if your customer already owns an in-app product and, if they don't, displays the purchase dialog so they can buy it.

trans-unit.source: Replace the comment "show the purchase dialog" with your custom code for the purchase dialog (such as a page with a friendly "Buy this app!"
trans-unit.target: Replace the comment "show the purchase dialog" with your custom code for the purchase dialog (such as a page with a friendly "Buy this app!"

trans-unit.source: button).
trans-unit.target: button).

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Change the test code to the final calls
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Change the test code to the final calls

trans-unit.source: This is an easy step: change every reference to [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) to [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) in your app's code.
trans-unit.target: This is an easy step: change every reference to [**CurrentAppSimulator**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779766) to [**CurrentApp**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779765) in your app's code.

trans-unit.source: You don't need to provide the WindowsStoreProxy.xml file any longer, so remove it from your app's path (although you may want to save it for reference when you configure the in-app offer in the next step).
trans-unit.target: You don't need to provide the WindowsStoreProxy.xml file any longer, so remove it from your app's path (although you may want to save it for reference when you configure the in-app offer in the next step).

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Configure the in-app product offer in the Store
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Configure the in-app product offer in the Store

trans-unit.source: In the Dev Center dashboard, define the product ID, type, price, and other properties for your in-app product.
trans-unit.target: In the Dev Center dashboard, define the product ID, type, price, and other properties for your in-app product.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you configure it identically to the configuration you set in WindowsStoreProxy.xml when testing.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you configure it identically to the configuration you set in WindowsStoreProxy.xml when testing.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [IAP submissions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148551).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [IAP submissions](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt148551).

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: If you're interested in providing your customers with consumable in-app product options (items that can be purchased, used up, and then purchased again if desired), move on to the [Enable consumable in-app product purchases](enable-consumable-in-app-product-purchases.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: If you're interested in providing your customers with consumable in-app product options (items that can be purchased, used up, and then purchased again if desired), move on to the [Enable consumable in-app product purchases](enable-consumable-in-app-product-purchases.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: If you need to use receipts to verify that user made an in-app purchase, be sure to review [Use receipts to verify product purchases](use-receipts-to-verify-product-purchases.md).
trans-unit.target: If you need to use receipts to verify that user made an in-app purchase, be sure to review [Use receipts to verify product purchases](use-receipts-to-verify-product-purchases.md).

trans-unit.target: Related topics
